channel.title: Logistic Regression on DFS
channel.description: Recent content in Logistic Regression on DFS

item.title: Classifying using Logistic Regression
item.description: 1 - Objective The objective of this example is to identify each of a number of benign or malignant classes. 2 - Data BCData <- read.table(url("https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/breast-cancer-wisconsin/breast-cancer-wisconsin.data"), sep = ",") # setting column names names(BCData)<- c('Id', 'ClumpThickness', 'CellSize','CellShape', 'MarginalAdhesion','SECellSize', 'BareNuclei', 'BlandChromatin','NormalNucleoli', 'Mitoses','Class') 3 - EDA - Exploratory Data Analysis dim(BCData) ## [1] 699 11 str(BCData) ## 'data.frame': 699 obs. of 11 variables: ## $ Id : int 1000025 1002945 1015425 1016277 1017023 1017122 1018099 1018561 1033078 1033078 .
